meanings.definition: To hear again, especially in a legal context.
meanings.sent1: The judge decided to rehear the witness's testimony.
meanings.sent2: I will rehear the audio recording to catch any missed details.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom was so noisy that the judge had to rehear the evidence.
meanings.sent4: After the long day, my mind felt like it needed to rehear the important information.
meanings.sent5: I rehear the legal terms in my head to remember them better.

meanings.definition: A second hearing or review of a case or matter.
meanings.sent1: The rehearing of the case brought new evidence to light.
meanings.sent2: The judge scheduled a rehearing for next week.
meanings.sent3: The rehearing turned into a lively debate among the lawyers.
meanings.sent4: The rehearing felt like a fresh start for the legal proceedings.
meanings.sent5: Attending the rehearing helped me understand the case better.
